us.phonetic: /ˈkɑntrɛri; for 3 also kənˈtrɛri/, (kon′trer ē; for 5 also kən trâr′ē)

example.eg: The two men always seem to have contrary opinions.
example.egtrans: 那两个人似乎观念总是对立。

example.eg: Contrary to his expectations, thousands of people were at the airport to welcome him.
example.egtrans: 与他预料的正相反：数千人来到了机场迎接他。

example.eg: She left the job because the company's policy on animal testing ran contrary to her beliefs.
example.egtrans: 由于公司在动物实验方面的政策与她的信念相悖，她辞了职。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与...有冲突, 与...相反, 与...相悖

example.eg: Some believe that scientific explanations destroy our appreciation of nature, but I have found the contrary to be true.
example.egtrans: 有的人认为，科学阐释摧毁了我们对大自然的欣赏，但我认为正相反。

us.phonetic: /ˈkɑntrɛri; for 3 also kənˈtrɛri/, (kon′trer ē; for 5 also kən trâr′ē)

example.eg: Josie was a contrary child, and she was prone to tantrums.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 固执的，任性的, 乖戾的

us.phonetic: /ˈkɑntrɛri; for 3 also kənˈtrɛri/, (kon′trer ē; for 5 also kən trâr′ē)

example.eg: You think people can't change?  On the contrary, they can!
example.egtrans: 你认为人是不会变的？恰恰相反，当然会！

example.eg: It is believed that I am pro-union. Quite the contrary, I am actually pro-business.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 完全相反地, 适得其反地, 正相反地
相反地, 恰恰相反地
